data.event: It was first mentioned in 1298 as Birmos.

event.title: formed a single community with Innerbirrmoos, but in 1633

data.event: Originally it formed a single community with Innerbirrmoos, but in 1633 the two communities separated to form independent municipalities.
It absorbed the land and population of the communities of Schöntal (BE) and Barschwand when they dissolved in 1887.
Otterbach is first mentioned in 1236 as Ottirbach.
Like Innerbirrmoos, around 1399 it became part of the Bernese district of Röthenbach and in 1529 the Landvogtei of Signau.
The hamlet of Linden was first mentioned in 1354.
All three municipalities, Ausserbirrmoos, Innerbirrmoos, and Otterbach, were part of the parish of Oberdiessbach until 1860, when they broke away to form the parish of Kurzenberg.

event.title: the creation of the independent municipality of Linden in 1945

data.event: After the creation of the independent municipality of Linden in 1945, it became the parish of Linden.

event.title: was built in the hamlet of Linden in 1848

data.event: The parish church was built in the hamlet of Linden in 1848.

event.title: the 1970s, a training base for the Swiss Army opened

data.event: Beginning in the 1970s, a training base for the Swiss Army opened in the community.
